info.name: API_contract_tests
info.description:
Contract tests using the tidepool API with the goal of testing the interaction between the Tidepool APis to see that its is working as a client expects. We are looking at

 - response code
 - response timing 
 - headers, specifically the x-tidepool-session and content type
 - response json data to make sure it matches our schema expectations at a high level

item.name: Clinician signup and setup

request.description:
Initial sign-up for the clinician account, which includes creation of the 
    
    `userId`
Send the email confirmation using the `userId` we picked up in the last request.
Get `emailKey` to use in next request to confirm email
Using `emailKey` to confirm email.
Accepting Terms and conditions
Setting up Name, clinic name, role and telephone number.
Verify user profile stored successfully.

item.description:
A normal upload session is used for “bulk” uploads.

An example of this is the Tidepool Uploader: When you use Tidepool Uploader, you are connecting a device to your computer, and using the Tidepool Uploader to read a large set of historical data from the device. Tidepool Uploader will create a normal upload session, and close that session when all data for that diabetes device has been uploaded.

Subsequent uploads for the same device will create a new normal upload session, and this data will be deduplicated against any previous sessions.
